metadata.Name: SberQuAD
metadata.Description: A Russian reading comprehension dataset inspired by SQuAD. It contains over 50,000 question-answer pairs based on 5,000 articles from Russian Wikipedia, annotated by humans via a crowdsourcing platform.
Provider: Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology
metadata.Paper Title: SberQuAD -- Russian Reading Comprehension Dataset: Description and Analysis
metadata.Venue Title: Proceedings of the 9th International Conference on Analysis of Images, Social Networks and Texts (AIST 2020)
metadata.Venue Name: International Conference on Analysis of Images, Social Networks and Texts
Affiliations: Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology
metadata.Abstract: We present SberQuAD, a new large-scale Russian reading comprehension dataset. It is inspired by SQuAD, a popular machine reading comprehension dataset for English. We crawled 5,000 articles from Russian Wikipedia and collected over 50,000 questions. The dataset was collected and annotated by humans on the crowdsourcing platform Yandex.Toloka. We provide a detailed description of the data collection and annotation methodology and analyze the main properties of the resulting dataset. We also present several baseline models, including a strong multilingual neural model, and compare their performance with human accuracy. The dataset is publicly available. We hope that SberQuAD will foster the research in Russian machine reading comprehension.
